summary: Open educational resources (OER) refer to teaching, learning, and research materials that are freely accessible and openly licensed, allowing for their use, adaptation, and redistribution. Within the EU legal framework, OER are increasingly recognized as vital for enhancing educational equity and fostering innovation in teaching methodologies. The European Commission promotes OER to support lifelong learning and improve the quality of education across member states. By facilitating access to diverse educational content, OER contribute to the organization of teaching, enabling educators and learners to engage with high-quality resources while adhering to principles of transparency and inclusivity in education.
